title: Besu does not complete snap sync, w/ bonsai tries
body:
### Description

Sometimes, Besu when synced from scratch on Ethereum mainnet will not succeed and then just show "Refreshing DNS record" over and over.

Some logs. I'll try this again with debug logs enabled, but chances are it'll work, as this issue is sporadic.

```
execution_1  | 2022-05-27 02:33:35.842+00:00 | EthScheduler-Workers-2 | INFO  | PersistBlockTask | Imported #14,851,594 / 37 tx / 0 om / 3,564,864 (11.9%) gas / (0xcbf7a67bc90fde71ec737f34057bf3fd55d0f331ebeea1da8aff2e394b29533a) in 0.745s. Peers: 28

```

After this point `Refreshing DNS records with enrtree://AKA3AM6LPBYEUDMVNU3BSVQJ5AD45Y7YPOHJLEF6W26QOE4VTUDPE@all.mainnet.ethdisco.net` repeats for hours, with no other logs.

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: besu/v22.4.1/linux-x86_64/openjdk-java-11
* OS Name & Version: Ubuntu 20.04
* Docker Version: 20.10.12
* Cloud VM, type, size: Baremetal, 6 cores, 32 GiB RAM

After restart, Besu did complete the sync. Attaching debug logs for that run.
[besu-sync-restart-dbg.log.gz](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/files/8786649/besu-sync-restart-dbg.log.gz)

Also faced this issue (with a few more Rocket Pool node operators) where after the initial sync, some block couldn't be imported and Besu started to lag behind saving blocks for future import. Only a restart managed to fix this.
We just merged a fix for that. thanks for your issue
